info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 7 at 3:43PM CDT until July 7 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following counties, Howard, Merrick and Nance.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly along some rural county roads and area creeks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to an isolated thunderstorm, with at least 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain having fallen within the last 45 minutes in parts of the Advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Additional rainfall of as much as 1 to 2 inches is possible over the next hour or so. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Elk Creek, Prairie Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Rock Creek, Horse Creek, Timber Creek, Prairie Slough and Spring Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Howard, Northwestern Merrick and Southwestern Nance Counties, mainly north of Palmer and east of Cushing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Howard, NE; Merrick, NE; Nance, NE
